page.title: 12OVERBURY SCHOOL MAYPOLE DAY
page.content: Every year at the end of May our School holds a{Maypole Celebration. The children in the Junior Class vote to choose a{May Queen}from the girls who are leaving that Summer. We walk from the School in a procession to {Overbury Court Gates,}carrying the Maypole.The Queen sits on her throne on a dais and the dancers present their posies,bow or cursty and then line up ready to sing and dance.The {Town Crier}announces the name of the {May Queen}and of the person who is to crown her.This person then takes a crown of flowers from the{Page Boy}and crowns the{May Queen.}After a song,six couples dance ,The Barbers Pole,Single Plaiting & Double Plaiting.The Infants then do their dance.We return,dance The Spider's Web and finish with the Barbers Pole.After three more songs we return to school for ice cream etc.
